thread.title: Kanye West Denies Calling Drake's Music 'Overplayed' | Angie Martinez | Power 105.1 FM
thread.title_full: Kanye West Denies Calling Drake's Music 'Overplayed' | Angie Martinez | Power 105.1 FM

title: Kanye West Denies Calling Drake's Music 'Overplayed' | Angie Martinez | Power 105.1 FM
text:
share 
What is Hip Hop without a little beef? 
We all love to hate and hate to love Kanye West and his rants and occasional antics; however when it comes to Drake and his music we may have to draw an invisible line when it comes to the Canadian rapper. 
Recently, in an interview with DJ Semtex, Drake reveled how he felt about Kanye West and their relationship, after he got news that Kanye supposedly said Drake was taking away airtime from other talented artists still with us? 
During the interview Drake stated: 
"I think everybody has their own little things going on, I’m not really sure what he’s referring to half the time, because in the same breath, I went from being… like working on a project with him, to him sorta publicly shi**ing on me and DJ Khaled for being on the radio too much." 
Later, Kanye responded in a video denying the claims, in the video he says his original comment was: 
“Radio, F**k you! I know it’s a lot of real ni**as working at radio, real people, real programming directors with wives and kids that love music, that can’t play what they want to play because they’ve been paid to play that bulls**t over and over and over. And when I say that bulls**t, what I’m saying is we love Drake, Drake is great. He’s a great artist. But Frank Ocean is great, too." 
Hopefully these two great rappers can overcome this little dispute and continue making great music possibly together. 
Photo: Getty Images {"position1":{"name":"Kanye West","id":34743,"url":"https:\/\/www.iheart.com\/artist\/kanye-west-34743","type":"artist","errors":null,"tagged":true}} ON AIR: Weekdays 2PM-6PM Angie Martinez is recognized as one of the most influential personalities in popular culture and multi-media. Originally known as “The Voice of New York,” Angie’s nearly 20 years of on-air hosting experience has led her to become the media trailblazer she is today: multimedia host, spokeswoman, actress, recording artist, entertainment personality, author and philanthropist. Known for her signature laid back style of interviewing, Angie is well respected — and praised — for her unique ability to get up-close and personal with larger-than-life personalities. Her storied experience and poise on the airwaves while interviewing such global icons as Bill & Hillary Clinton, Derek Jeter, Spike Lee, JAY Z and Beyoncé resulted in Martinez adding Special NY Correspondent for Extra TV to her current scope of work, where she has (so far) worked alongside Oprah Winfrey, Lady Gaga, Robert DeNiro and more. In addition to her professional work across the media landscape, Angie has become a passionate cultural voice for her community and fan base through HealthyLatinEating.com, which she founded in 2014 to share her love for — and support of — healthy Latin cuisine. And most recently, Angie dedicated herself to training for and completing the 2014 TCS New York City Marathon in support of The PitCCh In Foundation, where her team raised over $200,000 to benefit inner city youth. Fans can tune into The Angie Martinez Show on New York’s Power 105.1, weekdays from 2pm - 6pm, and on Miami’s The Beat 103.5, middays from 10am–2pm.
